John Garbero

Chesterfield, MO 63017 · (812) 803-9963 · john.garbero.itb@gmail.com

As both a software engineer and sociologist, I not only solve-problems using my technical skills, but I approach problems with a knowledge of the social forces involved and how they should be considered. I seek to bring such an approach to the tech world.

Projects

Speaking in Poems

Source Code | Website

Developed app for clients to create, share, favorite, and comment on a large variety of poems.

Features
  • Implemented authentication and authorization using Ruby on Rails to allow clients to perform CRUD actions.
  • Displayed multiple models with complex relationships using aliasing, giving the client permission to only perform CRUD actions on their own content.
  • Leveraged Material UI and CSS to provide a visually satisfying user experience.

Dishes to Fulfill Your Wishes

Source Code | Website

Collaborated with team to build an app for clients to login, select, create, edit, and review public recipes.

Features
  • Rendered complex data with multiple models in Ruby on Rails onto a React frontend using timed fetch requests so the client can view their info, recipes, and reviews without any errors.
  • Seeded the database with original data in Ruby on Rails so the client can view both reviews and recipes upon creating an account.
  • Used Material UI to provide a seamless user experience.

The Kitty Collective

Source Code (Frontend) | Source Code (Backend) | Website
  • Constructed a large collection of cats from an outside source so that the client can browse a large variety of cats.
  • Created a search feature using React and Material UI allowing the client to search the collection of cats according to their attributes.
  • Implemented CRUD in React so that the client can view, create, favorite, unfavorite, and delete a cat card.

Experience

Substitute Teacher

Kelly Services

I've been leading over 20 classrooms, which amounts to over 200 different students. I've also had to report back to teachers on their students and their progress.

March 2022 - Present

Student Academic Appointee

Indiana University--Department of Sociology

In this role, I did several things. I designed and taught a college level sociology course for over 40 undergraduate students. I also maintained and carried out the teaching, grading, and research tasks of several sociology faculty at IU. Lastly, I conducted independent and collaborative research on topics such as health, suicide, and politics using both qualitative and statistical software.

August 2019 - December 2021

Teaching and Research Assistant

Brigham Young University--Department of Sociology

At BYU, I handled up to four simultaneous research assignents and TA roles at once with professionalism and punctuality. In these positions, I assisted nearly a dozen different faculty with their research projects, grading tasks, and curriculum planning.

January 2018 - May 2019

Interests

Apart from being a web developer, I am pretty active. I lift, hike, climb, and I play on a gay rugby team. I also enjoy reading, solving jigsaw puzzles, and writing. And when I get the chance, I love spending my time in museums of any kind.

When I have free time, I love spending it with my friends and loved ones. I love going on long walks and talking about life and meaning with those important to me. This is what I feel like life is really about!
